value.description: A selection of 28 documents, created by geduldia
value.name: wikipedia_articles

component.name: Simple Tokenizer

produces_role.description: General information about this role: Detects linguistic tokens.
General information about this role: Detects sentence boundaries.

configuration.description: The locale that will be used to determine word and sentence boundaries. For best results, set this value to the language of the texts which are being processed. See http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Locale.html and http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/text/BreakIterator.html for technical details.
If true, the tokenizer will produce annotations for whitespaces. If this option is enabled, nearly twice as much annotations will be generated, such that itis set to false by default.

If true, the type id of an annotation will be calculated by the underlying string in lowercase letters. This reduces the overall quantity of types produced (at least if used for texts which contain lots of capital letters), however, it might affect the quality of components which make use of the type ids generated by this component.
If false, this component will be executed whenever used in an experiment. If true, the annotations produced by this component earlier will be reused if the execution prerequesites did not change.

author.name: Stephan Schwiebert
author.organization: Department of Computational Linguistics, University of Cologne

component.description: A quick and dirty layered tokenizer based on Java's java.text.BreakIterator.Intention of this tokenizer was to test the exchangeability of SPre and to offer a tokenizer which is "failsafe", as it cannot be misconfigured.Note, however, that other tokenizers will probably produce much better results than this one.

component.name: Stopword Marker

produces_role.description: General information about this role: Assigns multiple categories to tokens.

configuration.description: Each occurrence of a element in this list will be annotated with the selected label.
If enabled, upper-/lower case will be ignored
configuration.comment: The text is processed case sensitive.

configuration.description: If false, this component will be executed whenever used in an experiment. If true, the annotations produced by this component earlier will be reused if the execution prerequesites did not change.

component.name: Stopword Filter

produces_role.description: General information about this role: Filters annotations by their type idIf produced by 'Generic Range Filter': The generated filter, which can be applied on all annotations

includedObject.description: General information about this role: Generates anchored elements.If consumed by 'Generic Range Filter': The annotations which define if an annotation from will be filtered.

configuration.description: If enabled, an annotation is not accepted if it matches an annotation from 'Filter'. If disabled, an annotation will be accepted if it matches an annotation from 'Filter'
If false, this component will be executed whenever used in an experiment. If true, the annotations produced by this component earlier will be reused if the execution prerequesites did not change.

author.name: Stephan Schwiebert
author.organization: Department of Computational Linguistics, University of Cologne

component.description: Filters annotations depending on their range within a signal. Each annotation in 'Reference' is compared to the annotations in 'Filter', and if an annotation with the same range was found, the annotation is accepted, otherwise, it is rejected. This behaviour can be inverted by modifying the configuration of this component.

produces_role.description: General information about this role: Filters annotations by their type idIf produced by 'Simple POS Filter': The generated filter, which can be applied to all annotations

includedObject.description: General information about this role: Assigns POS Tags to wordsIf consumed by 'Simple POS Filter': The pos tags which define if an annotation from will be filtered.

configuration.description: If enabled, an annotation is not accepted if it matches an annotation from 'Filter'. If disabled, an annotation will be accepted if it matches an annotation from 'Filter'

component.comment: Let only pass nouns that are no stopwords.

includedObject.description: Filters annotations by their type id
Filters annotations by their type id
Filters annotations by their type id

configuration.description: If disabled (default), an annotation will be written if all filters accepted it. If enabled, it will be rewritten if one or more filters rejected it.

component.description: Calculates Term Frequency/Inverse Document Frequency of any data objects, based on their type id.

component.name: DocumentVectorGeneratorComponent

produces_role.description: General information about this role: Generates labeled double vectors.

includedObject.description: Provides access to the term frequency/inverse document frequency statistics.

configuration.description: The minimal number of overall occurrences of a single annotation to be represented in a vector.
If false, this component will be executed whenever used in an experiment. If true, the annotations produced by this component earlier will be reused if the execution prerequesites did not change.

component.description: DocumentVectorGenerator, a Tesla (http://www.tesla.uni-koeln.de) natural language processing component.

component.name: K-Means++ Clusterer

produces_role.description: General information about this role: Generates a weighted cluster.If produced by 'K-Means++ Clusterer': k different clusters. Each vector from 'Vectors' is assigned to exactly one cluster.

includedObject.description: General information about this role: Generates a vector representation of the processed data.If consumed by 'K-Means++ Clusterer': The vectors which will be clustered.

configuration.description: Random Seed for the cluster algorithm. Depending on this value, initial cluster centers will be chosen (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-means++ for details). If set to -1, a new seed will be used each time the component is executed. Note that you might want to set 'resuable results' to 'false' in this case.

The number of clusters. Choose this value with care, as the optimal number of clusters highly depends on the properties of the clustered data. If set to -1 (which is the default value), the number of clusters will be guessed with a simple rule of thumb: k = sqrt(n/2), where n is the number of vectors to cluster.See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-means_clustering and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Determining_the_number_of_clusters_in_a_data_set for details.

The maximum number of iterations. During each iteration, cluster centers may be modified and each vector may be assigned to a different cluster. If no cluster center was modified during an iteration, the algorithm terminates. Increasing this number will usually create better results, but also slow down the performance of the calcuation.
The distance function to compare two vectors.
Indicates, if members of clusters should be displayed in the report.
If false, this component will be executed whenever used in an experiment. If true, the annotations produced by this component earlier will be reused if the execution prerequesites did not change.

author.name: Stephan Schwiebert
author.organization: Linguistic Data Processing, University of Cologne

component.description: A simple KMeans++ Clusterer, which assigns vectors to K different clusters. The implementation of this component uses the KMeansPlusPlusClusterer of the apache.commons.math project.
